author: robocopsgonemad
content: I am assuming we didn't do a mergeNetSplit fork for Ropsten because it is deprecated, so Sepolia is the first net we've got one for. Is there any value in doing it on Ropsten anyway for testing? I am currently struggling with Besu maintaining peers on Ropsten once we enable the code that disconnects PoW peers, and was wondering if anyone else sees value in a forkId for a soon-to-be-deprecated Ropsten.

author: marioevz
content:
Hey all, I recently made a change in the Hive Engine suite to separate the tests into sub test suites, and just realized the naming is not very obvious in the https://hivetests2.ethdevops.io/ page: What was before `engine`, is now `engine` + `auth` + `sync` + `transition`.

I have a PR to change these names for it to be more obvious they are part of the Engine simulator here: https://github.com/ethereum/hive/pull/620
So the names will be `engine-api`, `engine-auth`, `engine-sync` and `engine-transition`...

`--sim ethereum/engine` still runs all the tests from all of these suites, so no CI changes are necessary...

Feedback welcome üëç

author: timbeiko
content:
> I am currently struggling with Besu maintaining peers on Ropsten once we enable the code that disconnects PoW peers
right, I feel like if we truly want to treat it as deprecated, then this is maybe a feature and not a bug? Otherwise, people will keep using it and we won't be able to sunset it.

author: daniellehrner
content: In my opinion as long as we support it, we should provide the best user experience possible. And not finding peers will be blamed on the clients not on the network itself.
